docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 (AP) -- Private reports from Buenos Aires today said an Argentine Government crisis was expected in the next few days and that Gen. Arturo Rawson, recently resigned Ambassador to Brazil, had been denied permission to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 31 (AP) -- Private reports from Buenos Aires today said an Argentine Government crisis was expected in the next few days and that Gen. Arturo Rawson, recently resigned Ambassador to Brazil, had been denied permission to return to Argentina.
docs.abstract: Cabinet crisis expected; ban on Gen Rawson return reptd

headline.main: URUGUAY SEES CRISIS IN ARGENTINE CABINET; Reported Ban on Rawson's Return Is Also Heard in Montevideo

docs.snippet: A Rodzinski to conduct Buenos Aires and Brazil concerts
docs.abstract: A Rodzinski to conduct Buenos Aires and Brazil concerts

headline.main: RODZINSKI MUSIC ENVOY; Will Conduct in Buenos Aires and Brazil During April-June
RUIZ GUINAZU RESIGNS; Argentine Envoy to Spain Alleged to Have Sponsored Axis Aide

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 5 (U.P.) -- Six Germans were sentenced to five to thirteen years' imprisonment each and a seventh ordered deported today when they were found guilty of a Nazi plot to occupy Uruguay with unidentified troops and convert the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 5 (U.P.) -- Six Germans were sentenced to five to thirteen years' imprisonment each and a seventh ordered deported today when they were found guilty of a Nazi plot to occupy Uruguay with unidentified troops and convert the country into a Nazi colony.
docs.abstract: 7 Gers headed by A Fuhrman sentenced for plot to occupy country and convert it into Ger colony

headline.main: URUGUAY DOOMS GERMANS; Six Get 5 to 13 Years in Plot to Nazify the Country
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED FEB. 5, 1944

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 12 -- Argentina may declare war on the Axis within a few weeks at the most, according to reports circulating here. Although these reports, originating in Montevideo, Uruguay, have not progressed beyond the rumor stage and have...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 12 -- Argentina may declare war on the Axis within a few weeks at the most, according to reports circulating here. Although these reports, originating in Montevideo, Uruguay, have not progressed beyond the rumor stage and have received no official confirmation, they have gained wide credence.
docs.abstract: war declaration reptd impending; govt silent

headline.main: WAR RUMOR STIRS ARGENTINE CAPITAL; Government Silent on Report That Declaration of Hostilities With Axis Impends

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 -- Dr. Adrian C. Escobar, Argentine Ambassador, revealed in presenting to President Roosevelt today his letters of credence that his government "without the most remote political aim," has proposed to adjacent countries the study...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15 -- Dr. Adrian C. Escobar, Argentine Ambassador, revealed in presenting to President Roosevelt today his letters of credence that his government "without the most remote political aim," has proposed to adjacent countries the study and formation of customs unions to facilitate trade.
docs.abstract: Amb Escobar on Argentine proposal for customs union study with Brazil, Uruguay, Bolivia, Paraguay and Chile

headline.main: ARGENTINA PLANS A CUSTOMS UNION; Escobar, New Envoy, Reveals Project in Presenting His Credentials to Roosevelt

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 15 -- A group of comparatively junior army officers, alarmed at reports that Argentina was about to declare war on the Axis, took possession of the Foreign Ministry this morning, ousting Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert and his...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 15 -- A group of comparatively junior army officers, alarmed at reports that Argentina was about to declare war on the Axis, took possession of the Foreign Ministry this morning, ousting Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert and his Under-Secretary, Oscar Ibarra Garcia.

headline.main: CABINET TOTTERS; Army Clique Acts to Forestall Buenos Aires Declaration of War
